title: Mainly fair weather expected to prevail today
byline: The Meteorology Department says mainly fair weather will prevail over most parts of the island.

title: Judge temporarily blocks Trump’s plan to put thousands of USAID staff on leave
byline: A federal judge on Friday dealt President Donald Trump and billionaire ally Elon Musk their first big setback in their dismantling of the U.S. Agency for International Development, saying he will order a temporary halt to plans to pull thousands of agency staffers off the job.

title: Nippon Foundation pledges support for Sri Lanka’s rural development
byline: A meeting between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and the Chairman of the Nippon Foundation in Japan Mr. Yōhei Sasakawa was held yesterday (07) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Several top cops including STF Commandant transferred
byline: Senior DIG Attorney-at-Law Waruna Jayasundara, who served as the Commandant of the Police Special Task Force (STF), along with several other high-ranking police officers, have been transferred.

title: Detention orders obtained on major criminals repatriated from Dubai
byline: Sri Lanka Police have obtained detention orders on the notorious criminal known as ‘Rotumba Upali’, who was brought back to Sri Lanka yesterday following his arrest in Dubai.

title: Further delays expected in salt imports?
byline: The Salt Producers’ Association has stated that the import of salt will be further delayed due to the delays in issuing the necessary certificates by the Food Control Administration Unit of the Ministry of Health.

title: Wreckage of missing commuter Alaska plane found with no survivors
byline: A small commuter plane that crashed in western Alaska on its way to the hub community of Nome was located Friday on sea ice, and all 10 people on board died, authorities said. The crash appeared to be one of the deadliest in the state in the last 25 years.

title: President invites exporters to rise again from the strong economic setback
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake invited Sri Lankan exporters to rebuild and thrive on a robust economic foundation.

title: Cause of repeated fires in “Krrish” building revealed
byline: The Fire Department has launched preliminary investigations into the two fires that broke out at the “Krrish” building, which is considered the tallest structure in Colombo.

title: BASL warns against ‘undue interference’ over AG’s decision on Lasantha murder case
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has expressed concern following media reports that suggest the Cabinet of Ministers may be considering a review of the Attorney General’s decision regarding the discharge of three suspects in the Lasantha Wickrematunge assassination case.

title: Technical discussions ongoing to implement India’s DigiLocker in Sri Lanka – envoy
byline: The High Commissioner of India, Santosh Jha has commended the digital initiatives recently launched by the Sri Lankan government, including the ‘GovPay’ platform for digitization of all government payments, and the introduction of the Electronic Birth, Marriage and Death Certificates facility for Sri Lankans abroad.

title: Modi’s BJP wins Delhi election after 27 years
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party will form the government in Indian capital Delhi after 27 years as it scripted an impressive election victory.

title: Netflix cancels controversial nine-hour ‘Prince’ documentary
byline: Dearly beloved, an eagerly-anticipated documentary about Prince has been canceled.

title: Govt to establish 24-hour Passport Office in Jaffna
byline: The government has decided to establish a new Immigration and Emigration Office in the Jaffna District, says Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala.

title: SLMC parliamentarian assaulted
byline: Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) Batticaloa District MP Mohamed Sali Naleem has reportedly been assaulted by an individual today (08).

title: At least 30 missing after China landslide
byline: At least 30 people have been reported missing after a landslide in south-western China, according to Chinese state media.

title: Water tariffs expected to be reduced by month-end
byline: The Ministry of Urban Development, Construction, and Housing says that water tariffs will be revised in line with the recent decrease in electricity rates, with the changes scheduled to take effect at the end of this month (February).

title: Teacher and wife arrested for abducting, assaulting deputy principal from same school
byline: A school teacher and his wife have been arrested for abducting, assaulting, and injuring the deputy principal from the same school.
